column4: Hi. I'm not a linux user, but installed Ubuntu to an other disk than my primary HD, to update the firmware of the primary HD. I have now the update program in a folder on my Desktop but it is green  and I'm not able to start it. what shall I do ? The file rights is:-rwxr-xr-x
... also showing the content of the folder with ls shows the file green.
Where are the instructions on how to use that file?
And whats that filename?
And where are the instructions on how to use that file to update the firmware?
The filename is green because the access rights 755 are set.
the insructions say execute 'fwupd /foo/bar'
I want a link to read the instructions on my own, please.
ok one minute ...
www.ocztechnology.com/files/ssd_tools/OCZ_Firmware_Update_Guide_8_12_2011_Linux_consumer_1.pdf
So just run: sudo ./fwupd /dev/yourdisk
DONT run it as long as you have no backup. Create a backup of that disk before.
A Backup is done.
Did you download the firmware update file itself, too? fwupd is just the executable to run the firmware update process.
yes. This executable downloads the firmware from internet.
So "no".
er ...yes
Maybe it's necessary to change some rights with 'chmod' ?? But I' don't know the syntax nor the right rights ...
No.
I already told you how to run that file.
why is the ./ necessary ? I was in the right folder ?
